sub_topic: Calculating the molar mass of inorganic compounds
message_1: Calculate the molar mass of Sodium Chloride (NaCl) in grams per mole.
message_2:
To calculate the molar mass of Sodium Chloride (NaCl), we need to find the sum of the molar masses of Sodium (Na) and Chlorine (Cl).

The molar mass of Sodium (Na) is approximately 22.99 g/mol, and the molar mass of Chlorine (Cl) is approximately 35.45 g/mol.

So, the molar mass of Sodium Chloride (NaCl) is:

Molar mass of NaCl = Molar mass of Na + Molar mass of Cl
Molar mass of NaCl = 22.99 g/mol + 35.45 g/mol
Molar mass of NaCl = 58.44 g/mol

Therefore, the molar mass of Sodium Chloride (NaCl) is approximately 58.44 grams per mole.
